titleStmt.title: Walters Ms. W.589, Two works on precious stones
Sirr al-asrār fī maʿrifat al-jawāhir wa-al-aḥjār
سر الاسرار في معرفة الجواهر والاحجار

title.note: Title given in preface and titlepiece (fol. 1a); a later hand inscribed the title on front flyleaf iia: Kitāb al-asrār fī khawāṣṣ al-jawāhir wa-aḥjār

titleStmt.title: Kitāb al-aḥjār
كتاب الاحجار

title.note: Title supplied by cataloger; not given in manuscript

author.name: Jamāl al-Dīn al-Tifāshī
جمال الدين التفاشي
Author may be the same as Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf al-Tifāshī (d. 651 AH / 1253 CE) (see Brockelmann, Geschichte, 1: 652)

availability.p: Licensed for use under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported Access Rights, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/legalcode. It is requested that copies of any published articles based on the information in this data set be sent to the curator of manuscripts, The Walters Art Museum, 600 North Charles Street, Baltimore MD 21201.

notesStmt.note: This codex contains two short works on precious stones ascribed to Jamāl al-Dīn al-Tifāshī and Aristotle. The piece attributed to Aristotle is likely to be a paraphrase or extract from that author's Liber mineralium (or Lapidarius). This anonymous Ottoman copy was written in 989 AH / 1581 CE, possibly in Syria.

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Arabic.

msItem.title: Sirr al-asrār fī maʿrifat al-jawāhir wa-al-aḥjār
سر الاسرار في معرفة الجواهر والاحجار

title.note: Title given in preface and titlepiece (fol. 1a); a later hand inscribed the title on front flyleaf iia: Kitāb al-asrār fī khawāṣṣ al-jawāhir wa-aḥjār

msItem.incipit: الحمد لله العلي المجيد القوي الشديد وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد ...

msItem.title: Kitāb al-aḥjār
كتاب الاحجار

title.note: Title supplied by cataloger; not given in manuscript

msItem.incipit: قال الحكيم ارسطوطاليس اعلم الجوهر عام فكبيره الدر ...

handDesc.handNote: Written in partly pointed naskh script in black ink with rubrics and incidentals in red
Written in partly pointed naskh script in black ink with rubrics and incidentals in red

decoDesc.decoNote: Illuminated titlepiece and medallion; framing lines in red

decoNote.title: Illuminated titlepiece and medallion
decoNote.note: This page has an illuminated titlepiece in the upper panel and an authorship statement in the central medallion.

decoNote.title: Illuminated headpiece
decoNote.note: This illuminated headpiece is inscribed with the doxological formula (basmalah) in the rectangular panel.

binding.p: Red goatskin (with flap); central lobed oval, pendants, and cornerpieces; doublures of brown goatskin with gold-painted central lobed oval

history.provenance: Erased bequest (waqf) seal, most probably of the Grand Vizier ʿAlī Pāshā; shelf mark 1830 or 8830 (fol. 1a)
history.acquisition: Walters Art Museum, 1931, by Henry Walters bequest
